definition: Mawangdui in Changsha, Hunan, a recent Han dynasty archaeological site
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
surname Wang
to rule/to reign over
to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount

sentences.english: The most persuasive evidence is the articles unearthed in Mawangdui Han Tomb.
sentences.chinese: 最有說服力的證據是在馬王堆漢墓中出土的。

sentences.english: The corpse was named "Corpse of Mawangdui" and this name has been accepted internationally.
sentences.chinese: 國際上已認同，將這種屍體命名爲“馬王堆屍”。

sentences.english: The system has been put into use in Changsha Mawangdui Unatended Substation.
sentences.chinese: 該系統已在長沙馬王堆無人值班變電站投入運行。

sentences.english: Interpreter: Now we are at the section of mawangdui.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們所在的就是長沙馬王堆漢墓區了。

sentences.english: Excavated from Tomb 1 at Mawangdui, Changsha city, Hunan province in 1972.
sentences.chinese: 1972年湖南省長沙市馬王堆一號漢墓出土。

sentences.english: Mawangdui Han Tomb Museum in Hunan Province in hospital.
sentences.chinese: 馬王堆漢墓在湖南省博物館院內。

sentences.english: The most persuasive evidence of Xiang Embroidery is the articles unearthed in Mawangdui Han Tomb.
sentences.chinese: 在湘繡最有說服力的證據是第馬王堆漢墓中出土。

definition: to read and interpret ancient texts/to decipher
Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties/generic term for historic period 220-589 between Han and Sui
to make a catalogue/catalogue/list
bamboo writing slips in ancient times (joined together to form whole scrolls)
complete and accurate
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
variant of 圖像|图像[tu2 xiang4]
to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
Paleolithic Era
philology
to comment on/commentary
sequel/continuation of a book
etiquette/system of rites
folklore
to translate (to another language)/to convert
